userInput.prompt: i want to pass the JLPT N2

testCase.expectations:
- should include "JLPT" without the "N2" level suffix
      - should include "Japanese"
      - all titles and descriptions in US English
      - no extra titles like "Japanese Language Proficiency Test", "JLPT N2 Preparation", etc
      - should NOT include any other suggestions

      
  - The main focus is the `title` field, no need to pay much attention to the `description` field
  - No level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - No words like "course" in the title
  - Titles are always in Title Case

steps.conclusion: None. The output follows the edge-case rules for language exams by providing exactly two suggestions: the exam family name (JLPT) and the language (Japanese). Titles are in Title Case, contain no levels or joiners, and are in US English. Descriptions are one sentence each and relevant.

The second description explicitly mentions the level (“JLPT N2”), which may slightly conflict with the expectation emphasizing inclusion of “JLPT” without the level suffix, even though the rule restricts levels only in titles. Also, the first description expands JLPT to “Japanese Language Proficiency Test,” which is acceptable but slightly inconsistent with the emphasis on the JLPT acronym.

Avoid referencing the specific level in the description to align fully with the expectation focus (e.g., say “JLPT exam” instead of “JLPT N2 exam”). Consider using the JLPT acronym in both descriptions for consistency and concision.
